        <title><![CDATA[Manager/ Sr. Manager - Risk (Credit Card Analytics)]]></title>
        <description><![CDATA[**Manager/ Sr. Manager - Risk (Credit Card Analytics)**
  

  
Location **Bangalore, India**
  

  
Apply Now (https://phg.tbe.taleo.net/phg03/ats/careers/v2/applyRequisition?org=FFBUSA&cws=42&rid=616)
  

  
Work Timings: 12:30 PM to 9:30 PM
  

  
Role Purpose:
  

  
Manage all the analysts in the Bangalore based team and develop their skills in using various risk management tools and techniques. Assist the department head in maintaining and enhancing productivity of the department.
  

  
Key Responsibilities:
  

  
+ Use risk management tools and models to drive analytics for consumer lending products.
  
+ Identify portfolio optimization opportunities and provide recommendations to Senior Management.
  
+ Lead a team of 3-5 analysts of varying experience levels. Be responsible for recruitment, retention and development of the team.
  
+ Support departmental head in all initiatives, and to function as department head as and when required.
  

  
Key Areas of Responsibility and Accountability:
  

  
+ As the second senior-most member of the team, assist the department head in all matters and depute for the department head when required. Develop competencies to assume the department head role at short notice.
  
+ Design and implement risk management models for consumer lending products.
  
+ Manage Projects, train and supervise team members in various risk management tools and techniques.
  
+ Acquire and update knowledge of 1FBSSPLs customer information database and overall business economics.
  
+ Undertake preparation and upgradation of risk related systems and policies.
  

  
Key Requirements:
  

  
+ Minimum 8 years of experience in an analytical role supporting a financial services business or businesses, of which at least 4 should be in the Credit Card domain.
  
+ Experience in analytical tools like SAS and SQL, and experience in R, Python, and Machine Learning would be an advantage.
  
+ Hands-on experience in statistical techniques like logistic regression, clustering, segmentation etc. Experience in Web Analytics would be a plus.
  
+ Self-driven, able to work in teams or independently.
  
+ Above average leadership and team management skills.
  
+ Excellent communication and problem solving skills.
  

  
About us:
  

  
1FB Support Services Private Limited (1FBSSPL) is a high growth, small format, and multi-discipline BPO/ KPO organization. The Company is engaged in the business of providing information technology management services, risk management services and contact centre based customer support and collection services to its parent 1st Financial Bank USA (1FBUSA).
  

  
1FBUSA is an FDIC-insured, state-chartered bank headquartered in Dakota Dunes, South Dakota, founded in 1910. It has multiple subsidiary operations in various locations across the United States. The bank is a leading provider of financial services to college students and graduates from coast to coast, and is committed to providing quality community banking services in South Dakota.
  

  
1FBSSPL offers you the opportunity to learn the credit card business, work with the latest technology, build new applications and systems, interact with US colleagues and have a direct impact on business outcomes in a collegial, family atmosphere and state-of-the-art work environment.
  

  
_Address:_ Tower C, Level 1, The Millenia, #1&2 Murphy Road, Ulsoor,  Bangalore-08
  
_Website:_   https://www.1fbusa.com/careers/
  

  
_Telephone:_ 91-80-40475900

        <description><![CDATA[**Loan Underwriter, SBA Real Estate**
  

  
Location **Sioux Falls, SD**
  

  
Apply Now (https://phg.tbe.taleo.net/phg03/ats/careers/v2/applyRequisition?org=FFBUSA&cws=42&rid=822)
  

  
**Title:**  Loan Underwriter, SBA Real Estate
  

  
Builder Finance Inc. or “BFI” finances homebuilders and home investors across the country. BFI provides construction loans, renovation loans, rental investment property loans, and more. Details about our services and corporate values are available at BuilderFinance.com.
  

  
The Loan Underwriter will work closely with a Vice President that has been with the company for nearly 8 years. This will provide the successful candidate with a great opportunity to learn and take over considerable responsibility.
  

  
The Loan Underwriter will learn to underwrite real estate loans in a manner consistent with the U.S. Small Business Administration (“SBA”) loan guaranty programs. Day-to-day responsibilities are likely to include but not be limited to items listed below.
  

  
+ Financial due diligence:
  
+ Underwrite an applicant’s ability to service debt.
  
+ On an ongoing basis, ensure timely collection of financial statements including but not limited to corporate financials and tax returns. Review statements for accuracy and completeness.
  
+ Real Estate due diligence:
  
+ Underwrite a client’s building experience and building credentials as part of the initial application.
  
+ Working with a client and third-party vendors to compile and underwrite necessary information on new and in-process projects.
  
+ Perform ongoing compliance work such as ensuring appropriate insurance coverage is maintained.
  
+ Prepare internal memoranda on specific projects.
